Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Plaunt St South Rehabilitation - Drinking Water
Description: The Town’s current cast iron watermain has been subject to the development of small mounds of corrosion, increasing pumping costs, reducing pressure as well as causing several leaks and water quality issues in the distribution system. This project will see the replacement of the water, sanitary and storm systems, thus helping to provide access to safe, clean drinking water to families and residents for years to come.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: The existing Cobden Wastewater Treatment Plant will undergo major upgrades, including the addition of a tertiary treatment facility and a new process train. Improvements will increase plant capacity, reduce the incidence of by-pass events, and improve wastewater effluent treatment in order to address environmental issues associated with Muskrat Lake.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project involves the reconstruction of Ridge Road and the installation of roadside safety devices.  The work also includes widening the surface and platform to meet current minimum standards and provide increased protection for alternative modes of transport. The rehabilitation of Ridge Road will help improve traffic flow and safety on this major local road for residents and visitors.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Marmora Watermain and Sanitary Sewer Extension
Description: This project involves the installation a new PVC watermain and new gravity sanitary sewer on Crawford Drive.  Once completed, local properties will be directly connected to the municipal water and wastewater system thus improving service efficiency and reliability to residents for years to come.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Raw Water Intake Pipe Twinning -  Dryden
Description: This project will involve the twinning of the raw water intake pipe running from the Low Lift Station on Dickson Road to the Water Treatment Plant on Wilde Street. Once completed, these upgrades will increase water services efficiency and reliability, helping to ensure healthy and safe drinking water supply for the community.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Geraldton Ward Main Street Sewer Upgrade
Description: This project will entail upgrades to Geraldton Ward Main Street sanitary system, including the construction of a second sanitary trunk sewer to increase hydraulic capacity and new interconnecting manholes at Waldrope Ave and McKenzie Ave. These improvements to the wastewater collection system will help reduce the volume of untreated wastewater effluent discharged as a result of sanitary sewer and combined sewer overflow events.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will include the construction of a new Stormwater Management pond on Midtown Creek to contain runoff during heavy rain events and the construction of a new concrete outlet structure to control the release of water. Once completed, the new structures will help reduce the likelihood of flooding thus contributing to managing the social and economic risks for local homeowners and businesses.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Upgrades to Public Drop-Off Areas at Landfill & Transfer Stations
Description: This project will see safety improvements and increased diversion options for the disposal of residential waste items that are not collected at curbside.  The public drop off areas at the County’s Brighton Landfill, and Bewdley and Seymour Transfer Stations will have additional bins or bunkers, raised curbs and walkways around unloading areas, new railings or fences around the outer edge, as well as new or refurbished Scalehouse Buildings.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Trenton Wastewater Treatment Plant Headworks Upgrades
Description: This project will see a number of upgrades to the plant in order to meet provincial and federal regulations and help remove unionized ammonia from the effluent stream. The work will include reconfiguring the screening and grit removal process sequence, replacing two new fine screens and two new vortex grit tanks, installing a new screenings washing and compacting system, new grit pumps and classifiers as well as implementing a new building odour control system to reduce air emissions to the City’s Centennial Park.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Grandview Drive & Susan Street Reconstruction / Development of Alternate Water Distribution Trunk Main
Description: This project will include the replacement of the cast iron water main that runs from Grandview Drive to the main trunk water main at the Meaford Water Treatment Plant, and restoration of this section of road. This initiative will help reduce the risk of further breakage and improve water quality by removing corroded pipes.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will see the reconstruction of Hume Street, including the replacement of watermains, sanitary sewers and storms sewers and improvements to the roadway pavement, turning lines, traffic signals and drainage facilities. Once completed, this project is expected to improve access to the Hospital as well as enhance safety for motorists, pedestrians and cyclists.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Pelee Drive Bevel Line Sanitary Sewer Collection
Description: This project will improve Pelee Drive and Bevel Line’s sanitary sewage collection system and connect it to the Leamington Pollution Control Centre for treatment. All property owners in the area will have the opportunity to switch from private septic systems in to a new network of municipal sanitary sewers.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Campbellford Potable Water Supply and Distribution System Upgrades
Description: This project will entail significant upgrades to the Campbellford Potable Water Supply and Distribution System, including the addition of new below-grade storage and the construction of a new high lift pumping station. Improvements will extend the functional lifespan of the system while helping to ensure a healthy and safe drinking water supply for the region.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project includes will see the full demolition, reconstruction and reinforcement of aqueducts and channels to contain and control flood waters in high flow events. Construction will also include waterproofing the structure for longevity and full restoration of above ground surface works, thus greatly reducing the risk of flooding and helping to protect the health and well-being of local residents.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will include the removal and replacement of the outflow structure, the installment of impermeable barriers to prevent seepage, the improvement of earthen embankments and the refurbishment of the pedestrian path and bridge over the dam, to make it accessible to all. These improvements will help to protect this 200-year-old dam from an impending break, which will help to ensure the safety and welfare of the local residents and safeguarding of the commercial core.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will see the complete reconstruction of Elora Street, including a major intersection that connects five separate roads, to replace aging water pipes and stormwater sewers. . The water infrastructure update will prevent future difficulties and the road work will help to move high volumes of traffic more efficiently while providing an opportunity to re-design the streetscape and upgrade the streetlights.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: The Cst. Rick Hopkins Bridge located on Highway 6 in the community of Mount Forest will undergo a series of structural improvements including railing, curb, sidewalk and beam replacement, as well as waterproofing and paving. Rehabilitation work will extend the functional lifespan of the bridge, while increasing safety for motorists and pedestrians alike.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will see the extension of the municipal watermain network, connecting Presqu'île to the Township of Alfred and Plantagenet municipal water filtration plant located in the Village of Lefaivre. Once completed, the new connection will provide safe, clean, high-quality-drinking water to residents of Presqu'île.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Ninth St. / Marleau Ave. widening and reconstruction
Description: The project involves reconstructing the urban roadway, from Marlborough Street to Alice Street including reconfiguration of the Marleau - McConnell Avenue intersection. The new road will have expanded capacity and new features, including four traffic lanes, turning lanes, bike lanes in each direction, sidewalks on both sides and a median within high pedestrian activity areas. The project will significantly increase safety in this area for motorists, cyclists and pedestrians and will accommodate anticipated future growth in the Cornwall Business Park.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: The project will help decrease pollutant loading to the Tay River through three components: the implementation of stormwater quality control measures on major outfalls, the planning and the commissioning of a sump pump disconnection program and the application of urban and rural best practices such as low impact development retrofits (LID) and septic system repairs. These initiatives will help improve the water quality of the Tay River to preserve the ecosystems and provide significant health and safety benefits to the residents of Perth.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: The reconstruction of Centre Street will include the replacement of the watermain to increase its capacity as well as the installation of a new sanitary sewer and a storm sewer system along with a roadway curb and gutter to improve drainage and reduce the risk of flooding. In addition, a cross sectional roadbed will be constructed in the middle of the right-of-way to enhance safety for motorists.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will include the installation of fiber optic cable in Bracebridge, Huntsville, Parry Sound, Burk's Falls, Sundridge, and Magnetewan, improving web access for residents, businesses and visitors. This initiative will help to bring high-speed online benefits to the region, such as email access, web browsing, e-commerce, and be a great resource for school work. It will also support the region’s long-term growth.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will see the replacement of the water and sewer mains and associated roadwork.  The new advanced water and sewer mains will help improve the efficiency and reliability of the wastewater treatment facility, raise water pressures in elevated areas, and allow for future growth west of town.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Highway 11 Connecting Link (Riverside to de l'Etang)
Description: This project will entail the replacement of Highway 11 connecting link and bridge, between Riverside and de l’Etang. Work will include the construction of new sidewalks and curbs, the application of new asphalt as well as associated wastewater work. Rehabilitation work will extend the functional lifespan of the bridge, while increasing safety for motorists and pedestrians alike.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Railway Street Reconstruction - 3rd Avenue to 12th Avenue
Description: The work will include the replacement of the surface, subgrade, watermain, sewer, storm sewer, curb, gutter and sidewalk from 3rd Avenue to 12th Avenue. These upgrades are expected to improve the safety and efficiency of the Town’s transportation network for residents and visitors.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will involve the replacement of the water and wastewater distribution lines through The Base area. Replacing this critical infrastructure will reduce the likelihood of sewage backups occurring in this residential area and will help decrease the frequency of overflowing sewers and manholes in the area.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project includes significant upgrades to the Whitney-Tisdale Sanitary System, including the refurbishment of six existing lift stations, several force mains, and the construction of two storm equalization tanks. Improvements will reduce potential impacts to the environment and residents, extend the lifespan of existing infrastructure, and improve overall operations.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This multi-phase project will see upgrades to Pumping Station No.2, Pumping Station No.4, and the Edgewater Pumping Station as well as the construction of a new forcemain and the decommissioning and rehabilitation of Edgewater Lagoon. These improvements will prevent future sewage bypasses, and will support a healthier environment.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: The Curry Marsh pumping station’s 40 years old pump will be replaced to ensure continued operation of the drainage system. Additional maintenance will also occur on East West and Parsons Roads to improve water flow. This project will help reduce the risks of flooding of local farmlands and vineyards and eliminate standing water by improving storm water flows.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Bluewater Shoreline Small Diameter Watermain Replacement
Description: Work will entail the replacement the existing watermain along the shoreline with larger diameter watermain to increase the capacity of the water distribution system. Once completed, these upgrades will help deliver efficient and reliable water services, improving the quality of drinking water in the municipality for years to come.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will include updates to Anishinabe of Wauzhushk Onigum drinking water Infrastructure to help ensure that residents and families continue to have access to safe, clean drinking water. In addition, a number of updates will be made to modernize the wastewater treatment system, ensuring a continued level of service while minimizing potential adverse environmental effects.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will entail a complete soil assessment of eight acres of land on Seventh Street to encourage residential development of the site. Ultimately, this initiative will help Red Lake boost regional development and remain a great place to work, live and raise a family.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will include the cleaning of a knitting mill and surrounding land to convert the historic masonry building into a high-quality living environment for tenants needing affordable housing.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: The Atikokan Sewage Treatment Plant will undergo a series of refurbishments in order to upgrade the aging facility. Upon completion, the plant will meet today’s operational standards, eliminating bypass during rainstorms, and will reduce the negative impacts of wastewater effluent on human health and will help support a healthier environment for the residents.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Construction of water supply infrastructure; includes water treatment plant, water distribution and storage reservoir
Description: This project will include the construction of a new, secure and reliable water supply system to meet the community's needs and provide safe, clean, high-quality-drinking water for local residents.
City/Town/Township: Mississaugas of Scugog Nation First Nation (Scugog)

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: Construction of water supply infrastructure; includes water treatment plant, water distribution and storage reservoir

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Baseline Road Bridge Reconstruction - Corp. of the Municipality of Clarington
Description: Reconstruction of Baseline Road Bridge will include the replacement and repair of the existing bridge infrastructure. These upgrades will enhance safety of the bridge and increase its functional lifespan.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Line 6 Reconstruction - Corp. of the Township of Scugog
Description: This project will involve the reconstruction of Scugog Line 6 from Highway 12 to west of Highway 7A. The two lane rural road will be converted to an urban road with sidewalks and median. These upgrades will help increased traffic flow and improve safety for motorists and pedestrians.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will include the extension of the existing fibre optic network to provide connectivity from Milverton to the hamlet of Nithburg. This initiative will help bring high-speed online benefits to local residents while supporting the region’s long-term growth

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Vankleek Hill Wastewater Treatment Plant upgrades
Description: This project will see the Vankleek Hill Wastewater Treatment Plant undergo a series of refurbishments aiming to upgrade the aging facility. Upon completion, the plant is expected to meet today’s operational standards, improving the quality of effluents in the receiving stream thus helping to support a healthier environment.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Catfish Creek Flood Disaster Mitigation Infrastructure
Description: This project will entail upgrading Catfish Creek’s sediment retention structure to increase its capacity. Once completed, these improvements will help reduce sediment loading and lessen the potential for flooding in future years.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will involve the replacement of the entire deck: new asphalt, sidewalks, guard rails and light standards, as well as major repairs to the substructure. This initiative will extend the life of the deteriorating overpass and allow the significant traffic volume to continue, avoiding further severe congestion issues and helping to provide an easier and safer commute for North Bay residents and visitors.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: County Road 3 Rehab Improvements to drainage including culterts
Description: The project includes the engineering, design and reconstruction of 8 km on County Road 3 between County Road 23 and Highway 62.  The work includes improvements to culverts and ditching to facilitate drainage as well as road widening to accommodate busses and cycling lanes. Once completed, this project will help to improve traffic flow and safety on this major road while increasing cycling opportunities for residents.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Organics Diversion program at Wollaston Waste Site
Description: This project will see the installation of three MOLOK containers, which are installed partially underground to help slow bacterial growth, with a lid that prevents the presence of vermin and scavengers.  The MOLOK ‘s will be used to  collect and store residential and commercial organic waste, thushelping to increase the quantity of solid waste diverted from disposal and providing a local, long-term solution to managing the Township's organic waste.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Gravenhurst Gigabit Community (Fibre to the Home and Business)
Description: This project will include the installation of optical fiber from a central point to make high-speed Internet access directly available to individual homes and business within the Town of Gravenhurst. The network is expected to offer cost effective Gigabit speeds to approximately 1350 homes and businesses in Gravenhurst.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Water Treatment Plant Upgrades; Morson; ON
Description: The project will include upgrades and expansion of the current water treatment plant to add a slow sand filtration process and accommodate new equipment.  Once completed, these upgrades will help the removal of organics as well as increase primary and secondary disinfection, improving the quality of drinking water in the Big Grassy First Nation community.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will see a number of upgrades to the Shelburne Wastewater Treatment Plant including improvements to the filtration system, power generator and the building’s roof and walls. These upgrades will help improve the building’s structure and extend the functional lifespan of the plant while helping to restore water quality in the Boyne River.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: Improvements to Main Street Bridge will include bridge rail barrier and asphalt replacement, waterproofing, and concrete curb, sidewalk and wing-wall repairs. Upgrades will help reduce travel times, enhance the structural integrity and safety of the bridge and increase its functional lifespan.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will include the installation of a new aeration system and the improvement of the chlorination system to enhance water disinfection. In addition, the overall operation and control infrastructure of the plant will be upgraded. By improving the efficiency and service reliability of the wastewater treatment facility this initiative will help protect the environment and ensure the health and safety of residents for years to come.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Sewer Tanks, Pump and Line Repairs/Replacement
Description: This project will include improvements and upgrades to the Bailey Bridge area wastewater infrastructure, providing increased capacity to manage sewage overflow in order to prevent backflow into residencies in the community.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will see the replacement of the existing sewer lines with PVC pipes to limit ground water infiltration thus helping to reduce the wastewater treatment costs. In addition, the watermain’s cast iron pipes part of the drinking water system will be replaced to eliminate the colour and odour associated with the pipes due to corrosion. Once completed, these water and wastewater infrastructure renewal will help provide clean, safe drinking water and sanitary sewer services to residents for years to come.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Georgina Island First Nation Water Plant Upgrade
Description: The project will include the construction of a new water treatment plant. This project will help meet current drinking water regulations thus helping to provide access to safe, clean drinking water to the community families and residents.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Emergency Access Road Re-Development; Emergency Access Road; PO Box 68; Fort FrancesON; P9A 3M5
Description: The project will include the re-development of an emergency access road surrounding water crossings and the installation of box culverts to establish stormwater management drainage. Once completed, this project will ensure safe access to the Nigigoonsiminikaaning First Nation community during emergencies.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Emily St. watermain and sanitary sewer upgrades
Description: This project will include the installation of new watermains, sanitary sewers, a storm sewer system and associated roadwork. Providing much needed upgrades modernizations to Emily Street’s drainage system while providing an opportunity to improve road infrastructure for the safety and security of motorists and pedestrian alike=.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will add a preliminary treatment, aeration tanks, secondary clarifiers, and tertiary filters to the Plant’s treatment system.  The new tanks will be set up next to the existing facility to ensure that there is no disruption to service during the construction period.  These upgrades will help reduce the negative impacts of wastewater effluent on human health and will help support a healthier environment for the residents of Petrolia and adjacent properties.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will see a number of renovations to the Waste site to make it safer, more user-friendly as well as to help increase the quantity of the solid waste diverted from disposal and to reduce the environmental impacts from our landfill. The existing entrance will be widened, the weight scale will be relocated and a second will be added and the recycling area will be re-located.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: City of Sarnia Sewer Upgrade Project
Description: This project will involves the replacement of the Green Street pump station, upgrades to the Bright's Grove Wastewater Treatment Facility and to Sarnia’s Water Pollution Control Centre as well as a new pumping station in New Bedford.  These improvements will help reduce sewer overflow into the St. Clair River and restore the water quality in the river and in the Great Lakes.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project entails various upgrades to the Village of Burk’s Falls Water System.  The village’s steel water storage tank will be replaced by a larger, glass-fused steel standpipe. A new system will be installed to control standpipe overflow as well as a new electronic application to monitor water levels. Upgrades will extend the functional lifespan of water system infrastructure while ensuring access to clean and reliable drinking water for local residents.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: The Project involves the complete reconstruction of Ambridge Drive, north of the intersection of Main Street to the intersection of Synagogue Avenue, in the Town of Iroquois Falls.  Work will include watermain and sanitary sewer replacements as well as associated roadwork. New watermains and storm sewers will reduce potential impacts to the environment due to overflows, while the rehabilitated road will provide smoother and safer commutes for motorists and pedestrians alike.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will involve extending the existing water distribution system from the First Nation system to the Township of Armstrong’s watermain. Once completed, the new connection will help provide safe, clean, high-quality-drinking water for local residents.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will include the installation of new sanitary and storm sewers as well as a bigger watermain on Foster Avenue. Once completed, these upgrades will increase water services efficiency and reliability by improving fire protection and reducing water leakage, the use of treatment chemicals and the number of boil water advisories.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Thorold Municipal Non Profit Housing Brownfield Redevelopment Project
Description: This project will include the evaluation of former industrial land in Thorold to select a site for cleaning and redevelopment. This will make way for an affordable senior citizens apartment building, in order to help the municipality promote sustainable development standards that balance social, economic and environmental benefits.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Reconstruction of Colonization Road East from Scott Street intersection to just north of 5th Street Intersection
Description: The project involves the reconstruction of Colonization Road East, from south of the Scott Street intersection to north of the 5th street intersection, and associated wastewater work. Once completed, the work will help improve pedestrians and motorists safety on this high capacity road.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: The rehabilitation work of King Street drinking water and wastewater infrastructure will include the replacement of existing watermains, main line valves, sanitary sewers, sanitary manholes, storm sewers, storm manholes and catch basins within the right-of-way as well as associated roadwork. These improvements will help maintain reliable and sustainable water and wastewater services, improve local traffic flow and support the quality of life of Havelock residents.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: Upgrades to the Township of Asphodel-Norwood’s Water Treatment Plant will include the installation of a new water softening system to prevent the interference of hard water in the carbon dioxide process.  In addition to helping to prevent future leaks and flooding, the new system will prevent excess copper in drinking water, protecting users from mold and ensuring a clean and safe drinking water supply for residents.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Old Barrie Rd East and Hwy 11 North and South Bound Ramps
Description: This project entails various road and intersection improvements throughout Orillia, including road realignment, off-ramp extensions, and the creation of new intersections and roadways. Improvements will help prepare the city for future economic growth while providing safer and smoother commutes for pedestrians and motorists.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project will include the removal and replacement of existing water, sanitary and storm sewer infrastructure along Main Street to meet the needs of this growing municipality for years to come.  The project will also include adding new streetscaping features, such as tree plantings, to help enhance and revitalize the downtown core.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Bethune St Sanitary Sewer and Jackson Creek Diversion Project
Description: This project will entail three components: the installation of a storm sewer in Jackson Creek to mitigate flood damage; the reconstruction of Bethune Street; and the increase of sanitary sewer capacity in the north end of Peterborough. These improvements will help reduce the social, physical and economic risks associated with flooding and will serve population growth in the area.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: The proposed project will include watermain replacements, sanitary sewer repairs, and storm sewer improvements throughout Loyalist Township. Improvements will help extend the functional lifespan of the sanitary sewer system while ensuring a healthy and safe drinking water supply for the region.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Watermain Replacement in the Village of Oshweken - Six Nations of the Grand River Territory
Description: This project will include the replacement and upgrade of sections of the watermain which are undersized and in poor condition as well as the associated road work in Ohsweken, to increase the capacity and reliability of the water distribution system. Once completed, these upgrades will enable Six Nations to meet the minimum fire protection requirements, which enhances community safety. These upgrades are also a critical step in empowering Six Nations with the ability to expand its’ water distribution system to the other 90% of what is the largest First Nation in Canada, in order to provide the entire Six Nations of the Grand River community with a safe and reliable supply of potable water.
City/Town/Township: Village of Oshweken - Six Nations of the Grand River Territory (near Brantford)

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Sioux Lookout Airport Terminal Building Expansion and Renovation
Description: This project involves the reconfiguration of the circulation spaces and the retail and concession areas to ensure that the flow of passengers is straightforward, efficient and unconstrained. These expansion and upgrades will help ensure that carriers, air ambulance operators, charters and aircraft maintenance businesses operate with greater efficiency as they continue servicing northern and remote communities.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: This project includes the remediation of municipal brownfield lands on Grand River Avenue to make way for the construction of affordable housing. The project is expected to increase the availability of affordable residential units for seniors in Brantford.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description: The Chute-à-Blondeau wastewater treatment plant will be replaced to increase operational capacity and improve effluent quality. Upon completion, the plant is expected to meet today’s operational standards, and support a healthier environment for the residents.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Marine Emergency Duties Training and Research Centre
Description: This project will entail the construction of a new Marine Emergency Duties (MED) Training and Research Centre at the Owen Sound Campus of Georgian College. Once completed, the new centre, the only accredited Ontario-based MED centre, will help sustain mandatory post-secondary marine education and training and will enhance the capacity for collaborative applied research within and beyond the marine industry.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Lambton College Centre for Health Education and Sustainable Care (CHESC)
Description: Lambton College’s proposed Centre for Health Education and Sustainable Care (CHESC) will unite students, faculty, and researchers under one roof. This innovative facility will feature multi-functional laboratories, collaborative meeting spaces, and large interactive learning studios, bringing Lambton College to the forefront of health education and research, and contributing to the long-term viability of the College.

Ministry Lead: Ministry of Economic Development, Employment and Infrastructure
Partner Ministry: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Project Name: Bulk Item and Household Hazardous Waste Depot
Description: The creation of a Bulk Item and Household Hazardous Waste Depot will provide Woodstock residents with a convenient method for disposing of residential waste items that are not collected at curbside. Creation of a formal and permanent drop off area will help divert hazardous waste from landfills, while protecting the environment and safeguarding residents’ health and safety.
